00021 #include <stddef.h>
00022 #include <stdint.h>
00023 #include <stdlib.h>
00024 #include <errno.h>
00025 #include <ccn/ccn.h>
00026 #include <ccn/seqwriter.h>
00027 
00028 #define MAX_DATA_SIZE 4096
00029 
00030 struct ccn_seqwriter {
00031     struct ccn_closure cl;
00032     struct ccn *h;
00033     struct ccn_charbuf *nb;
00034     struct ccn_charbuf *nv;
00035     struct ccn_charbuf *buffer;
00036     struct ccn_charbuf *cob0;
00037     uintmax_t seqnum;
00038     int batching;
00039     int blockminsize;
00040     int blockmaxsize;
00041     int freshness;
00042     unsigned char interests_possibly_pending;
00043     unsigned char closed;
00044 };
00045 
00046 static struct ccn_charbuf *
00047 seqw_next_cob(struct ccn_seqwriter *w)
00048 {
00049     struct ccn_charbuf *cob = ccn_charbuf_create();
00050     struct ccn_charbuf *name = ccn_charbuf_create();
00051     struct ccn_signing_params sp = CCN_SIGNING_PARAMS_INIT;
00052     int res;
00053     
00054     if (w->closed)
00055         sp.sp_flags |= CCN_SP_FINAL_BLOCK;
00056     if (w->freshness > -1)
00057         sp.freshness = w->freshness;
00058     ccn_charbuf_append(name, w->nv->buf, w->nv->length);
00059     ccn_name_append_numeric(name, CCN_MARKER_SEQNUM, w->seqnum);
00060     res = ccn_sign_content(w->h, cob, name, &sp, w->buffer->buf, w->buffer->length);
00061     if (res < 0)
00062         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&cob);
00063     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&name);
00064     return(cob);
00065 }
00066 
00067 static enum ccn_upcall_res
00068 seqw_incoming_interest(
00069                        struct ccn_closure *selfp,
00070                        enum ccn_upcall_kind kind,
00071                        struct ccn_upcall_info *info)
00072 {
00073     int res;
00074     struct ccn_charbuf *cob = NULL;
00075     struct ccn_seqwriter *w = selfp->data;
00076     
00077     if (w == NULL || selfp != &(w->cl))
00078         abort();
00079     switch (kind) {
00080         case CCN_UPCALL_FINAL:
00081             ccn_charbuf_destroy(&w->nb);
00082             ccn_charbuf_destroy(&w->nv);
00083             ccn_charbuf_destroy(&w->buffer);
00084             ccn_charbuf_destroy(&w->cob0);
00085             free(w);
00086             break;
00087         case CCN_UPCALL_INTEREST:
00088             if (w->closed || w->buffer->length > w->blockminsize) {
00089                 cob = seqw_next_cob(w);
00090                 if (cob == NULL)
00091                     return(CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK);
00092                 if (ccn_content_matches_interest(cob->buf, cob->length,
00093                                                  1, NULL,
00094                                                  info->interest_ccnb,
00095                                                  info->pi->offset[CCN_PI_E],
00096                                                  info->pi)) {
00097                     w->interests_possibly_pending = 0;
00098                     res = ccn_put(info->h, cob->buf, cob->length);
00099                     if (res >= 0) {
00100                         w->buffer->length = 0;
00101                         w->seqnum++;
00102                         return(CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_INTEREST_CONSUMED);
00103                     }
00104                 }
00105                 ccn_charbuf_destroy(&cob);
00106             }
00107             if (w->cob0 != NULL) {
00108                 cob = w->cob0;
00109                 if (ccn_content_matches_interest(cob->buf, cob->length,
00110                                                  1, NULL,
00111                                                  info->interest_ccnb,
00112                                                  info->pi->offset[CCN_PI_E],
00113                                                  info->pi)) {
00114                     w->interests_possibly_pending = 0;
00115                     ccn_put(info->h, cob->buf, cob->length);
00116                     return(CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_INTEREST_CONSUMED);
00117                 }
00118             }
00119             w->interests_possibly_pending = 1;
00120             break;
00121         default:
00122             break;
00123     }
00124     return(CCN_UPCALL_RESULT_OK);
00125 }
00126 
00127 /**
00128  * Create a seqwriter for writing data to a versioned, segmented stream.
00129  *
00130  * @param name is a ccnb-encoded Name.  It will be provided with a version
00131  *        based on the current time unless it already ends in a version
00132  *        component.
00133  */
00134 struct ccn_seqwriter *
00135 ccn_seqw_create(struct ccn *h, struct ccn_charbuf *name)
00136 {
00137     struct ccn_seqwriter *w = NULL;
00138     struct ccn_charbuf *nb = NULL;
00139     struct ccn_charbuf *nv = NULL;
00140     int res;
00141     
00142     w = calloc(1, sizeof(*w));
00143     if (w == NULL)
00144         return(NULL);
00145     nb = ccn_charbuf_create();
00146     ccn_charbuf_append(nb, name->buf, name->length);
00147     nv = ccn_charbuf_create();
00148     ccn_charbuf_append(nv, name->buf, name->length);
00149     res = ccn_create_version(h, nv, CCN_V_NOW, 0, 0);
00150     if (res < 0 || nb == NULL) {
00151         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&nv);
00152         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&nb);
00153         free(w);
00154         return(NULL);
00155     }
00156     
00157     w->cl.p = &seqw_incoming_interest;
00158     w->cl.data = w;
00159     w->nb = nb;
00160     w->nv = nv;
00161     w->buffer = ccn_charbuf_create();
00162     w->h = h;
00163     w->seqnum = 0;
00164     w->interests_possibly_pending = 1;
00165     w->blockminsize = 0;
00166     w->blockmaxsize = MAX_DATA_SIZE;
00167     w->freshness = -1;
00168     res = ccn_set_interest_filter(h, nb, &(w->cl));
00169     if (res < 0) {
00170         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&w->nb);
00171         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&w->nv);
00172         ccn_charbuf_destroy(&w->buffer);
00173         free(w);
00174         return(NULL);
00175     }
00176     return(w);
00177 }
00178 
00179 /**
00180  * Append to a charbuf the versioned ccnb-encoded Name that will be used for
00181  * this stream.
00182  *
00183  * @param w the seqwriter for which the name is requested
00184  * @param nv the charbuf to which the name will be appended
00185  * @returns 0 for success, -1 for failure
00186  */
00187 int
00188 ccn_seqw_get_name(struct ccn_seqwriter *w, struct ccn_charbuf *nv)
00189 {
00190     if (nv == NULL || w == NULL)
00191         return (-1);
00192     return (ccn_charbuf_append_charbuf(nv, w->nv));
00193 }
00194 
00195 /**
00196  * Write some data to a seqwriter.
00197  *
00198  * This is roughly analogous to a write(2) call in non-blocking mode.
00199  *
00200  * The current implementation returns an error and refuses the new data if
00201  * it does not fit in the current buffer.
00202  * That is, there are no partial writes.
00203  * In this case, the caller should ccn_run() for a little while and retry.
00204  * 
00205  * It is also an error to attempt to write more than 4096 bytes.
00206  *
00207  * @returns the size written, or -1 for an error.  In case of an error,
00208  *          the caller may test ccn_geterror() for values of EAGAIN or
00209  *          EINVAL from errno.h.
00210  */
00211 int
00212 ccn_seqw_write(struct ccn_seqwriter *w, const void *buf, size_t size)
00213 {
00214     struct ccn_charbuf *cob = NULL;
00215     int res;
00216     int ans;
00217     
00218     if (w == NULL || w->cl.data != w)
00219         return(-1);
00220     if (w->buffer == NULL || size > w->blockmaxsize)
00221         return(ccn_seterror(w->h, EINVAL));
00222     ans = size;
00223     if (size + w->buffer->length > w->blockmaxsize)
00224         ans = ccn_seterror(w->h, EAGAIN);
00225     else if (size != 0)
00226         ccn_charbuf_append(w->buffer, buf, size);
00227     if (w->interests_possibly_pending &&
00228         (w->closed || w->buffer->length >= w->blockminsize) &&
00229         (w->batching == 0 || ans == -1)) {
00230         cob = seqw_next_cob(w);
00231         if (cob != NULL) {
00232             res = ccn_put(w->h, cob->buf, cob->length);
00233             if (res >= 0) {
00234                 if (w->seqnum == 0) {
00235                     w->cob0 = cob;
00236                     cob = NULL;
00237                 }
00238                 w->buffer->length = 0;
00239                 w->seqnum++;
00240                 w->interests_possibly_pending = 0;
00241             }
00242             ccn_charbuf_destroy(&cob);
00243         }
00244     }
00245     return(ans);
00246 }
00247 
00248 /**
00249  * Start a batch of writes.
00250  *
00251  * This will delay the signing of content objects until the batch ends,
00252  * producing a more efficient result.
00253  * Must have a matching ccn_seqw_batch_end() call.
00254  * Batching may be nested.
00255  */
00256 int
00257 ccn_seqw_batch_start(struct ccn_seqwriter *w)
00258 {
00259     if (w == NULL || w->cl.data != w || w->closed)
00260         return(-1);
00261     return(++(w->batching));
00262 }
00263 
00264 /**
00265  * End a batch of writes.
00266  */
00267 int
00268 ccn_seqw_batch_end(struct ccn_seqwriter *w)
00269 {
00270     if (w == NULL || w->cl.data != w || w->batching == 0)
00271         return(-1);
00272     if (--(w->batching) == 0)
00273         ccn_seqw_write(w, NULL, 0);
00274     return(w->batching);
00275 }
00276 int
00277 ccn_seqw_set_block_limits(struct ccn_seqwriter *w, int l, int h)
00278 {
00279     if (w == NULL || w->cl.data != w || w->closed)
00280         return(-1);
00281     if (l < 0 || l > MAX_DATA_SIZE || h < 0 || h > MAX_DATA_SIZE || l > h)
00282         return(-1);
00283     w->blockminsize = l;
00284     w->blockmaxsize = h;
00285     return(0);
00286 }
00287 
00288 int
00289 ccn_seqw_set_freshness(struct ccn_seqwriter *w, int freshness)
00290 {
00291     if (w == NULL || w->cl.data != w || w->closed)
00292         return(-1);
00293     if (freshness < -1)
00294         return(-1);
00295     w->freshness = freshness;
00296     return(0);
00297 }
00298 /**
00299  * Assert that an interest has possibly been expressed that matches
00300  * the seqwriter's data.  This is useful, for example, if the seqwriter
00301  * was created in response to an interest.
00302  */
00303 int
00304 ccn_seqw_possible_interest(struct ccn_seqwriter *w)
00305 {
00306     if (w == NULL || w->cl.data != w)
00307         return(-1);
00308     w->interests_possibly_pending = 1;
00309     ccn_seqw_write(w, NULL, 0);
00310     return(0);
00311 }
00312 
00313 /**
00314  * Close the seqwriter, which will be freed.
00315  */
00316 int
00317 ccn_seqw_close(struct ccn_seqwriter *w)
00318 {
00319     if (w == NULL || w->cl.data != w)
00320         return(-1);
00321     w->closed = 1;
00322     w->interests_possibly_pending = 1;
00323     w->batching = 0;
00324     ccn_seqw_write(w, NULL, 0);
00325     ccn_set_interest_filter(w->h, w->nb, NULL);
00326     return(0);
00327 }
